quest.name: Carnivals and Confrontations
journal: The dig site chief has a request for you. You could not possibly guess who it concerns.

As usual, the dig site chief is worried about Anogg and Konogg─or rather, their capacity to wreak havoc if left to their own devices for long enough. He also mentions that they have been shirking their village duties to continue their research into the key that you located in the Copied Factory, and asks that you remind them of this fact after you have finished confirming whether they've set anything on fire.

Per the chief's request, you speak to Anogg, who immediately expresses her frustration with the progress of their tinkering. Said progress, as Konogg explains, is in fact quite substantial─the two have been able to confirm that the device you recovered is in fact the “key” to some manner of weaponry, and were even able to get it working. Alas, its energy reserves ran dry soon after, and it will require additional power if it is to fulfill its purpose. This is typically the point at which one or the other of them would request you find a power source for them, but their incessant need to bicker reasserts itself at the critical moment, sparing you being set a new task. For now.
objectives: Speak with Anogg in the excavation tunnels.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Lali-what a conveniently timed entrance-ho! I was just thinking that I ought to send someone to check on Anogg and Konogg.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: They're still poking and prodding at those whatsits you dug up in the ruins. Which is all well and good until one of them sets off another explosion...

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Say no more. I wouldn't want anything to happen to the artifacts.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Oh, I'm sure you'll notice if they blow up anything important.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Thank you. You know how they get when they're curious about something.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: By which point it'll be too late!

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Not to mention that our annual carnival is fast approaching. There's plenty that wants doing before we're ready, and I need those two to start pulling their weight.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: While you're looking in on them, remind them they've got duties outside of tinkering with rusty thingamabobs, will you? Maybe they'll listen if it's you doing the nagging.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: They seem to respect you─much as they respect anyone. Must be all the violence.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: You'll find them in the tunnels, of course. Can't lure them out of there for love nor money─and believe me, I've tried.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Don't like to leave those two unsupervised when I can help it, but I've got my hands full as it is.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Maybe it's supposed to do that...?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: ANOGG
dialogue.text: Ah, there you are. Can you believe this!?

dialogue.name: ANOGG
dialogue.text: I waited through days of “processing,” broke multiple tools, and after all of that...

dialogue.name: ANOGG
dialogue.text: Ugh. Ugh! Stupid son of a hob-swiving...

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Anogg, not everyone is privy to your inner thoughts. Allow me to explain.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: The pod confirmed that this device grants the user access to some sort of weaponry, which presumably means that it is indeed the key of which 2P spoke.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, no sooner had we gotten it working than it stopped again. Based on our previous experiences, we assume that it's run out of power, and will require a supplementary energy source.

dialogue.name: ANOGG
dialogue.text: So let's hurry up and find one! The sooner we get the key working, the sooner we can pulverize our enemies.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Now, wait just a moment. We aren't even certain what sort of weaponry is involved here. Even if we get the key working again, we shouldn't activate it willy-nilly.

dialogue.name: ANOGG
dialogue.text: Honestly, Konogg. This ceaseless whining of yours is why we never make any progress!

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: It's not whining, it's being ethical and prudent!

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Must you two always bicker so?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Shall the victor be the first to draw blood, or the last man standing?

dialogue.name: ANOGG
dialogue.text: (-Anogg and Konogg-)Yes!

dialogue.name: ANOGG
dialogue.text: (-Anogg and Konogg-)Why not both?
